reviewText: This Shonen-ai has a pretty good storyline. This series has some moments of comedy, mystery, and some crazy situations. I would highly recommend this series for any Shonen-ai fan.

reviewText: EveryOne Loves An UnderDog!! Our Main Character Here Is Just That... He's Not As Talented As The Others Or As Smart But He Spends His Time Making New Friends, Blazing A Path Of His Own And Reliving ChildHood Memories!! This Is A Very Cute 'Boy Meets Boy' Kind Of Story And Much Like Sukisho The Bond The Lovers Share Has Strength From Younger Years!!One Small Let Down, After Purchasing I OBVIOUSLY Watched It All The Way Through... Near The End One Episode Has A MASSIVE Skip In It BUT If You REWIND To JUST AFTER The Skip It Plays PERFECTLY!! Just A Small Inconvenience, Nothing Major Enough To Warrant A Return Or Even A Mark Down In Stars...
Title: N/A

reviewText: For the price this was a steal. Too bad though that this is so short. Plus in the description box it says English dubbed but IT'S NOT. THIS IS English subbed and thats it. If you hate reading subtitles I suggest you move on. But beyond that its a great story as long as boy love interest doesn't bother you either.
summary: THIS IS NOT English dubbed, BUT STILL GOOD

reviewText: The whole boy's school meme is popular in Japanese manga/anime and this one is a classic.  I love this story and the art is very beautiful.  I have watched these dvds endlessly.  It's really sweet and comforting. In the original manga it's a multi-universe where Keita has a different boyfriend in different books but this is based of the best volume of that series as he is befriended by Kazuki who is a student but secretly runs the school. If you like this,"Loveless" is another good anime.  There are many similar mangas such as "Demian Syndrome", "Komatta" and "Takumi-Kun"...
summary: This anime got me through some hard times in my life...
